title.native: 鬼滅の刃 無限列車編
title.english: Demon Slayer -Kimetsu no Yaiba- The Movie: Mugen Train

description: This Demon Slayer movie sees Tanjiro Kamado and friends from the Demon Slayer corps board the Infinity Train on a new mission to investigate a mysterious series of disappearances, perpetrated by a demon who has been tormenting people and killing the demon slayers who oppose it.
synonyms: Els Guardians de la Nit: El Tren Infinit
Guardianes de la Noche: Tren Infinito
ดาบพิฆาตอสูร เดอะมูฟวี่ : ศึกรถไฟสู่นิรันดร์
Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba - Le film : Le train de l'Infini
ΚΥΝΗΓΟΣ ΔΑΙΜΟΝΩΝ: KIMETSU NO YAIBA – Η ΤΑΙΝΙΑ: ΤΟ ΤΡΕΝΟ ΜΟΥΓΚΕΝ

tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Trains
tags.description: Prominently features trains.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

title.native: 鬼滅の刃
鬼滅の刃
鬼滅の刃 無限列車編 (TV)
鬼滅の刃 遊郭編

node.description: Author of Kimetsu no Yaiba and Haeniwa no Zigzag. On February 2021, Gotouge was selected for the TIME 100 Next list, making it the first time a mangaka appears on the list.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/松島晃)

Originating from Jec.E, currently affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).

After graduating from middle school he entered Yoyogi Animation vocational school where he fell in love with animation. He then joined Jec.E, a sub-contracting studio. After it's bankruptcy he went freelance, but had a seat he used for workspace at Studio Elle. In 2010, he joined [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/) and has been one of its key members since, together with animators like [Nozomu Abe](https://anilist.co/staff/116271/), [Masayuki Kunihiro](https://anilist.co/staff/146702/) and [Masaru Kimura](https://anilist.co/staff/146698/). In 2019, he served as the character designer and chief animation director on [Demon Slayer](https://anilist.co/anime/101922/) and the [movie sequel](https://anilist.co/anime/112151/) following it, which became the highest-grossing anime film and Japanese film of all time.

Highly praised for his work as an animation director on [Rurouni Kenshin](https://anilist.co/anime/45/), [Hunter x Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/136/) and [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/).

Influenced by the likes of [Tetsuya Nishio](https://anilist.co/staff/103725/) and [Nobuteru Yuuki](https://anilist.co/staff/97010/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/外崎春雄)

Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).

[Website](http://www.lxixsxa.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/lxixsxa/) | [Profile (Anison)](http://anison.info/data/person/29206.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LiSA_OLiVE) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/xlisa_olivex/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/lisaSMEJ) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lxixsxa.jp) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA_(Japanese_musician,_born_1987)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA)

LiSA is a Japanese singer, songwriter and lyricist from Seki, Gifu. LiSA started her own band while in high school to catch a growing wave of punk rock. In 2008, she moved to Tokyo in order to further her musical career. The name "LiSA" stands for "Love is Same All" or "LiVE is Smile Always."

She announced her marriage to voice actor and singer [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735/Tatsuhisa-Suzuki) on January 22, 2020.

[Website](http://www.lxixsxa.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/lxixsxa/) | [Profile (Anison)](http://anison.info/data/person/29206.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LiSA_OLiVE) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/xlisa_olivex/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/lisaSMEJ) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lxixsxa.jp) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA_(Japanese_musician,_born_1987)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA)

LiSA is a Japanese singer, songwriter and lyricist from Seki, Gifu. LiSA started her own band while in high school to catch a growing wave of punk rock. In 2008, she moved to Tokyo in order to further her musical career. The name "LiSA" stands for "Love is Same All" or "LiVE is Smile Always."

She announced her marriage to voice actor and singer [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735/Tatsuhisa-Suzuki) on January 22, 2020.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

Yuki Kajiura was born in Japan but raised in West Germany for most of her childhood. Her father was a big fan of classical and opera music and always desired for Yuki to play the piano for him. Yuki eventually gained a love for music and a love for the piano. Yuki started out as an SE programmer, but changed to music in 1992. She made her grand debut with a female trio called "[See-Saw](https://anilist.co/staff/104342)."  In the years to come the group released six singles and two albums. 

Yuki then went on to work on her solo career composing for artists and some TV, films, and games, such as _Blood: The Last Vampire_ in 2001, and _Xenosaga II_ and _III_. In 2001, Yuki's claim to fame came with the release of the anime [_NOIR_](https://anilist.co/anime/272). The soundtrack sold 50,000 copies. In 2002, she was brought on to project .hack to write the score to [_.hack//SIGN_](https://anilist.co/anime/48), along with vocalist [Chiaki Ishikawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101059) and New York singer [Emily Bindiger](https://anilist.co/staff/103845). Shortly after Yuki comprised an album of original and complied songs known as Fiction, working again with Emily Bindiger as well as _Xenosaga_ vocalist Deb Lyons.  

Yuki's other well-known works were for [_Mobile Suite Gundam Seed_](https://anilist.co/anime/93), which hit 5th on the Oricon Charts its first week, and selling over 200,000 copies. Yuki has also become known for her work on CLAMP's [_Tsubasa Chronicle_](https://anilist.co/anime/177) series, [movie](https://anilist.co/anime/807), and [OVAs](https://anilist.co/anime/2685). In 2003, she formed the project [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691) in which pairs Yuki's songwriting and composition with different performing vocalists, first as separate solo works and later into a singular group. In 2007, Yuki formed the band [Kalafina](https://anilist.co/staff/101975), with two partners from FictionJunction, Wakana Ootaki and [Keiko Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/104664), to perform for the anime [_Kara no Kyoukai_](https://anilist.co/anime/2593), further working on several others. Kalafina disbanded in 2018, with their final lineup including Wakana, Keiko, and [Hikaru](https://anilist.co/staff/168857).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenarto) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ken_arto/)

Ken Arto is a half French half Japanese man, having a French father and Japanese mother. He is an animator for many popular series and debuted as an animator for anime in "JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Golden Wind". He had a love for animation and drawing since a young age, and graduated from the Academy of Clermont-Ferrand in artistic trades

Originating from [Imagin](https://anilist.co/studio/75/).
Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/外崎春雄)

Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cnago) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/椎名豪)

Masaru Shiina, known professionally as Go Shiina, is a freelance composer and arranger.

He joined Namco in 1997, and was best known during his time with the company for writing music for a number of games in the Tales, Mr. Driller, and God Eater franchises, He gained widespread recognition with his score for Tales of Legendia in 2005. Since then, he has also contributed music for several titles in the Tekken, Ace Combat, and The Idolmaster franchises.

In anime he is most noted for the score of [Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba](https://anilist.co/anime/101922/) together with [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077/).
Retired as an animator in the early '00s.
Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).

Affiliated with [Ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).

Famous for Directing and Storyboarding the Iconic Episode 19 of [Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba](https://anilist.co/anime/101922/Demon-Slayer-Kimetsu-no-Yaiba/).

Initially, he did not want to become a director, but when he served as the animation director for episode 3 of [Fate/Zero Season 2](https://anilist.co/anime/11741/FateZero-Season-2/), "The Terminus of Honor,'' he became interested in the direction of [Takashi Suhara](https://anilist.co/staff/146678/Takashi-Suhara), a director affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/ufotable). [In Fate/stay night: Unlimited Blade Works](https://anilist.co/anime/19603/Fatestay-night-Unlimited-Blade-Works/), Shirai not only made his debut as a storyboard and director for TV anime but also contributed to the art design.

According to ufotable's representative director and president, [Hikaru Kondou](https://anilist.co/staff/103076/Hikaru-Kondou), he mentioned that Toshiyuki Shirai is a staff member who, despite being young, can be entrusted with crucial story elements and scenes . [In Fate/stay night: Unlimited Blade Works 2nd Season](https://anilist.co/anime/20792/Fatestay-night-Unlimited-Blade-Works-2nd-Season/), Shirai took In charge of the storyboard and direction for the final decisive battle in episode 12, titled "Unlimited Blade Works." The original creator, [Kinoko Nasu](https://anilist.co/staff/98250/Kinoko-Nasu), highly praised Shirai, stating, "It's craftsmanship to the extreme. You did a splendid job".

In [Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba](https://anilist.co/anime/101922/Demon-Slayer-Kimetsu-no-Yaiba/), Shirai handled the storyboard, direction, and layout for episode 19, titled "Hinokami." The original creator, [Koyoharu Gotouge](https://anilist.co/staff/119973/Koyoharu-Gotouge), expressed admiration, saying, "The animation, direction, music, everything is so amazing that I cried a lot and watched episode 19 about 20 times. I'm truly glad I worked so hard on the manga." This episode received high acclaim not only from Japanese viewers but also internationally. 

Specializing in action-oriented direction, Toshiyuki Shirai made his Series directorial debut with [Katsugeki TOUKEN RANBU](https://anilist.co/anime/21742/Katsugeki-TOUKEN-RANBU/) in 2017.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/外崎春雄)

Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).
Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).

Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/) since 2006.

Graduating from Osaka University of Arts, Suhara, who had a fondness for drawing, assisted in the production of independent animated works by his junior, [Yuichi Terao](https://anilist.co/staff/130063/Yuuichi-Terao), who currently serves as the chief of ufotable's digital imaging department. After completing his university studies, Suhara, drawn to his passion for drawing, learned about Terao joining ufotable and subsequently joined the company in the spring of 2006.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/松島晃)
